dublin_core.dcvalue: There are no standardized methods for monitoring appetite in free living populations Fifteen participants tested a computer automated text messaging system designed to track hunger ratings over seven days Participants were sent text messages SMS hourly and instructed to reply during waking hours with their current hunger rating Of 168 SMS 0 6 7 1 were undelivered varying by mobile service provider On average 12 SMS responses were received daily with minor variations by observation day or day of the week Compliance was over 74 and 93 of the ratings were received within 30 min Automated text messaging is a feasible method to monitor appetite ratings in this population
Project TwEATs. A feasibility study testing the use of automated text messaging to monitor appetite ratings in a free-living population.
